location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Accompaniment to Report by Mr H A Armstrong on the Preliminary Survey of the Route for a Telegraph Line from Quetta to the Persian Frontier, 1901'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paperDimensions: 318 x 498mm, on sheet 408 x 505mm

mods.abstract: A map showing the proposed route for a telegraph line through Baluchistan and Persia. Alternative routes are also depicted. Along the route details of human settlement and topography are given. Beyond the route only political boundaries and some major towns are shown.The sheet contains a key and the printing statement: 'Intelligence Branch. Topo Dy No. 4,095, Exd C. J. A. June 1901'. The map is numbered 1828-I, 1901.
